Documentation: [https://vfox.lhan.me/zh-hans/]( https://vfox.lhan.me/zh-hans/)

Repository: [https://github.com/version-fox/vfox]( https://github.com/version-fox/vfox)


Currently supported SDKs by the community:

[![plugins]( https://skillicons.dev/icons?i=java,kotlin,nodejs,flutter,dotnet,python,dart,golang,maven,zig,deno&theme=light)]( https://github.com/version-fox/version-fox-plugins)


The main thing is that you can experience the same effect as asdf under Windows (non-WSL).
Of course, it's better than it, hahaha.
I thought it was right-click menu in the lower right corner > jdk > 1.8, 11, 17, select and then switch.
Typing commands is not interesting.
Awesome, starred

Okay, start it, I'll try it later.

After reading the website introduction, I thought the idea was very good. I downloaded it and tried it, it's really easy to use ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘. Switching versions will be so cool in the future, no more digging through folders.
Interesting, starred
@Incrus I don't know if I understood your question correctly, there are three ways.
1. If there is a mirror on the internal network, you can directly change the address of the nodejs plugin to the internal network address.

chunks.zh: 2.å› ä¸º vfox å®Œå…¨ä¾èµ–æ’ä»¶æ¥è·å–æ•°æ®æºçš„, æ²¡åŠæ³•ç›´æ¥é€šè¿‡å‘½ä»¤å¯¼å…¥å®‰è£…åŒ…, ä½†æ˜¯å¯ä»¥å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæ’ä»¶, æ’ä»¶é‡Œé¢æŒ‡å®šç¦»çº¿å®‰è£…åŒ…çš„ä½ç½®, ä¾› vfox ç®¡ç†
chunks.en: 2. Because vfox completely relies on plugins to obtain data sources, there is no way to directly import the installation package through commands, but you can implement a plugin, and specify the location of the offline installation package in the plugin for vfox to manage.
3. vfox ultimately manages the files in the $HOME/.version-fox/cache directory, another way is to directly throw the installation package into it.
Gentoo's eselect?
ğŸ‘ I'll definitely use this solution for new environments. The current work environment already uses different tools to manage versions, which is too much trouble, so I'll leave it as is.
Is the difference between this and nvm that this can manage more tools?
Speaking only for npm, are the functions the same as nvm?

chunks.en: Plugin management and SDK management are easily confused. It is recommended to refer to the subcommand designs of docker container and docker image to distinguish them.

chunks.en: I first added java/adoptium-jdk, and then tried to install v21, but exited halfway because the download was slow, and then tried to remove the plugin, but got the error message "java/adoptium-jdk not installed".

chunks.zh: é‚£ä¹ˆæˆ‘æƒ³æ¢å¦ä¸€ä¸ªæºï¼Œæ‰§è¡Œ "vfox add java/azul-jdk" æ—¶ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¾—åˆ°é”™è¯¯ä¿¡æ¯ "plugin java already exists"ï¼Œç°åœ¨æ˜¯è¿›é€€ä¸èƒ½äº†ã€‚
chunks.en: So I wanted to switch to another source and executed "vfox add java/azul-jdk", but also got the error message "plugin java already exists", now I can't move forward or backward.
Feedback: The download was blocked due to network issues. After Ctrl+C, the installation was not successful but displayed as successful.
I have solved it by deleting the cache, but the program can be optimized better.
